Unfortunately I can't figure that one out without some detective work on yo=
ur park.  Can you try using #if 0 or comments to isolate the part of the co=
de that is causing that failure?  It must be something that's included befo=
re HCUBE_STL.h that is causing issues, possibly the latest version of WxWid=
gets.  Try reordering some of the includes in HCUBE_Defines, put #include "=
HCUBE_STL.h" first so that you can be sure it won't error and see what happ=
ens.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "ker_31_toluca" <ker_31_toluca@...> wrot=
e:
>
> 
> 
> thanks. I got past this error, but i am now getting a new one =
when compiling with wxWidgets. Without widgets it finishes compilation ok.

> > > > You are absolutely right, the manual forgot to include the Board li=
brary as a dependency and where to get it:
> > > > 
> > > > http://libboard=
.sourceforge.net/  libBoard is used by the python visualizer to create docu=
ment-ready images of substrates as displayed in http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/pub=
lications/2010/gauci.nc10.html .
> > > > 
> > > > I created a cmake build s=
ystem for libboard that the developers have adopted into their source tree,=
 so the procedure of building libboard is similar to building tinyxmlplus.
=
> > > > 
> > > > I will update the manual and release a new version of the =
code with the updated manual and a copy of libboard included in the next fe=
w days.
